sub_title: Wastewater treatment | Anaerobic digestion | Frugal innovation | Waste-to-energy solutions
summary: Passionate and results-oriented environmental engineer with research experience (PhD) in biological wastewater treatment. Professional experience in Environmental Management and International Development and Sustainable Innovations. Interests linked to resource recovery from wastewater, environmental and industrial biotechnology, bioprocess design, waste-to-energy solutions, circular economy, decarbonization and sustainable development. Always looking for opportunities to make impact with contextualized technological solutions.

• Collaborated with multidisciplinary team members in Ecuador, Uganda and India to "frugalize" biogas cleaning and anaerobic treatment of effluents from food and feed industry. • Contributed to and actively participated in research conception, design and execution of "frugal innovations" for anaerobic waste treatment in 3 agricultural projects in Ecuador 
• Contributed to and actively participated in research conception and design of "innovative" sanitation solutions for emerging neighbourhoods in the Philippines

• Leveraged interpersonal and communication skills to mentor 4 graduate and 1 undergraduate students.', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Delft', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Early Stage Researcher in the SuPER-W Program Department of Sanitary Engineering Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences Project: Steering Product Formation in High-Pressure Anaerobic Digestion Systems 

This particular research project aims to explore the feasibility that inside the context of a biobased economy, wastewater can become an innovative source of organic “feedstocks”. The use of high-pressure technology, which is widely applied in other fields of industrial biotechnology, could reveal interesting features of microbial communities which can be exploited to improve the overall performance and stability of the bioprocess.

• Performed independent research into high-pressure anaerobic digestion to advance scientific knowledge in resource recovery from wastewater. These valuable contributions are summarized in 4 scientific publications, participation in 5 international academic conferences, 5 Marie Curie training workshops and industrial internship at Paques BV, Netherlands.
• Learned new laboratory techniques such as Next Generation Sequencing and Flow Cytometry and applied this expertise in carrying out enhanced experiments under supervision of senior lab members.
